thread.title: Earthmoving Equipment Market in Malaysia forecasted to grow 6.5% annually
thread.title_full: Earthmoving Equipment Market in Malaysia forecasted to grow 6.5% annually | MENAFN.COM

author: Press
title: Earthmoving Equipment Market in Malaysia forecasted to grow 6.5% annually
text:
(MENAFN Press) Fast Market Research announces the availability of Technavio's new report "Earthmoving Equipment Market in Malaysia 2015-2019" on their comprehensive research portal.
Earthmoving equipment refers to heavy equipment used in the construction industry to move large amounts of earth dig foundations for buildings and landscape areas. The various types of earthmoving equipment include excavators loaders and construction tractors. The earthmoving equipment market is one of the major segments of the construction equipment market.
Technavio's analysts forecast the earthmoving equipment market in Malaysia to grow at a CAGR of 6.55% over the period 2014-2019.
Get More Details on this Report and a Full Table of Contents at 
The report analyst commented "Ownership of construction equipment involves huge initial investment. Construction companies especially SMEs face budget constraints in ownership of earthmoving equipment. This has resulted in manufacturers promoting their equipment through rentals. To meet growing demand for earthmoving equipment in Malaysia leading vendors such as Caterpillar and Volvo are offering rental services to their customers. Equipment can be rented by customers on a daily or annual basis. The lease period is often less than the average lifetime of the equipment. This allows construction companies to use high-cost earthmoving equipment without major monetary investments and contributes to profits of earthmoving equipment manufacturers. Auxiliary services such as specialist consultation and proactive maintenance are also offered to customers renting the equipment."
According to the report rapid growth of the economy of Malaysia has led to increase in purchasing power of the growing middle-class population. Rapid growth of the economy combined with steady growth in the population of the country has generated immediate demand for housing units. As of 2013 the country reported a housing shortage of 18.8 million units. The governing body for residential development in the country NHB has planned to invest profusely in development of public housing especially for the lower income group of the population to overcome the growing shortage of housing units. Earthmoving equipment is required for effective implementation and timely completion of residential development projects; hence demand for earthmoving equipment in the country is continuously increasing because of growth of residential construction.
Further the report states that the high prices of raw materials is one of the key challenges for the market.
The key players in the Earthmoving Equipment Market in Malaysia are Caterpillar Hitachi Construction Machinery JCB and Komatsu while other prominent vendors include Liebherr Group and Volvo
The study was conducted using an objective combination of primary and secondary information including inputs from key participants in the industry. The report contains a comprehensive market and vendor landscape in addition to a SWOT analysis of the key vendors.
